issue.title: lexically_relative on UNC drive paths (\\?\C:\...) results in a default-constructed value

discussion.p: As a resolution to LWG , in path lexically_relative(const path& base) const, bullet 3.4 was added:

blockquote.p: If: […] any filename in relative_path() or base.relative_path() can be interpreted as a root-name, […] returns path().

discussion.p: This resolution was correct when we have really weird paths like abc\X:\c, but the MSVC standard library implementation treats UNC drive-relative paths as:

If we were able to go back in time, we might have root-name = \\?\C:, but we can't make that change at that point without silently breaking users; therefore, we believe it would be best to instead change lexically_relative() to work around this issue.
There exists a related github issue.
I don't yet have standard wording, but I think it would be reasonable to do something like:

blockquote.p: If relative_path().has_root_path() && base.relative_path().has_root_path(), and relative_path().root_path() == base.relative_path().root_path(), then return relative_path().lexically_relative(base.relative_path()).
